about details: Human rights and development Organization (HUDO)Together we can!who are we???human rights and development Organization (HUDO) is an independent, non-governmental, non-partisan and non-profit organization, dedicated to the promotion and protection of human rights,peace building and development. It was established to provide its services in the state of South Kordofan in Sudan. It was registered with the state’s Joint Humanitarian Aid Commission (HAC/SRRC) on October 25, 2009 AD and was known as a voluntary non-governmental organization (the last renewal was on February 13, 2011 AD - where it is renewed annually and valid for one year). In June 2011, when the conflict broke out in South Kordofan, HUDO was closed and its license was revoked by the Sudanese authorities. Despite that, it continued to operate in stressful and dangerous conditions. In order to continue its mission, HUDO moved to Uganda and officially registered under the same name. It also expanded its work to include all of Sudan and Sudanese refugees in Uganda and South Sudan(HUDO) is fully committed to achieving sustainable development, promotion and human happiness away from racial, religious, gender or political discrimination. (HUDO) is a human rights organization that operates on the principle of two components (physical and sensory) in all its programs and activities in terms of design or implementation, so that the physical component is the implemented activities interspersed with the sensory that represents the dimension of the human right. Regardless of whether the program implemented is developmental, rebuilding or relief. The human sensory dimension, which is the pillar of the organization, is more clear and focused in revealing the causative roots.
